text: Libourne (; ) is a commune in the Gironde department in the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region in southwestern France. It is a sub-prefecture of the department. It is the wine-making capital of northern Gironde and lies near Saint-Émilion and Pomerol, both known for their wines. ==History== Libourne was created as a bastide by Roger de Leybourne in 1270. The original name of Leybourne changed to the present Libourne. Its original aim was to be a port to ship wine of the Dordogne valley to England. ==Geography== Libourne is at the confluence of the Isle and Dordogne rivers. The city is at about from Bordeaux and from Arcachon. It has an area of , and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Libourne and its neighboring communes Libourne is surrounded by the communes Les Billaux, Lalande-de-Pomerol, Pomerol, Saint- Émilion, Moulon, Génissac, Arveyres, Fronsac and Saillans. ===Climate=== The climate of Libourne is Marine West Coast Climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb), with mild winters and warm summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Libourne are known, in French, as Libournais (women: Libournaises). With a population of 24,595, Libourne has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Libourne and the administrative centre () of the canton of Le Libournais-Fronsadais with 53,307 inhabitants (2014).: It is part of the intercommunality Le Libournais (). === Twin towns === Libourne is twinned with: * Morocco * Berne, Switzerland * Morocco Casablanca, Morocco ==Gallery== File:Vineyards in St Emilion.jpg|Vineyards in St Emilion File:Libourne 33 Porte du Port 2013.jpg|Porte du Port File:Libourne 001.jpg|Bridge over the Dordogne river File:Libourne.mairie.jpg|Libourne town hall File:Libourne église St Jean (19).JPG|Saint Jean church ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Libourne * Communes of the Gironde department ==References== ==Other websites== * Ville de Libourne - Official site * Departamental Council of Gironde * Prefecture official website * Agence de Développement Touristique de la Gironde * Région Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Bastides Category:Subprefectures in France Category:Communes in Gironde Category:Wine regions of France
